metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20021 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
LibVNC before commit c3115350eb8bb635d0fdb4dbbb0d0541f38ed19c contains a CWE-835: Infinite loop vulnerability in VNC client code. Vulnerability allows attacker to consume excessive amount of resources like CPU and RAM

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20021` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

italc-client - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
italc-management-console - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
italc-master - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
libitalccore - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

libvncclient1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libvncserver-config - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libvncserver1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: italc package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1').
libvncserver package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1').
ssvnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
tightvnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
